title: Have any tiring activities coming up? Learn how 'sleep banking' can make you more focused
description: Sleep banking means getting extra sleep ahead of time to build up a reserve against upcoming sleep loss. This practice helps reduce the drop in alertness, focus, and performance when sleep gets short later. Studies show it works best for planned tough periods like long shifts, wedding, travel, or night duties, not as a fix for ongoing poor sleep

While India leads Japan and Russia, a significant gap remains with China and the US, the top two superpowers.

Hanumankind, Diplo, Dot and three insane days at Motoverse 2025
description:
Hanumankind leading a convoy through Goa. Diplo dropping bhangra-EDM at Vagator Hilltop. Dot and the Syllables bringing indie energy to a packed crowd. Three days inside Motoverse 2025 felt like stepping into a live-action music video, with bikes, gigs, food, gear drops and a community that knows how to show up.

This video feature goes inside everything: the festival chaos, the Hunter 350 rides across Goa, new Royal Enfield gear launches, the Comic Helmet, the Motowave X2 Bluetooth unit, the Motoverse Collection, dyno runs, Maut Ka Kuan, Moto Polo, and nightlife that collided with IFFI.

And somewhere between the ride-outs and the gigs, a former long-distance rider found himself falling in love with motorcycling all over again.

While some praised his civic sense, others suggested authorities should lead such initiatives.

The proposed facility would assemble battery systems, utilizing Chinese-sourced cells while developing local racks and software. This move comes as India faces storage shortages, hindering its renewable energy expansion and grid stability.

description: The New York Mets are reportedly eyeing San Diego Padres pitcher Michael King as their next major acquisition following Dylan Cease's record-breaking contract. King, who excelled as a starter before a mid-season injury, now represents a high-upside option for the Mets amidst a shifting pitching market.  His potential return to peak form makes him an intriguing target.

title: Nick Fuentes seeks proof after Candace Owens links deaths to alleged plot
description: Candace Owens' explosive claims on X, alleging French President Macron and his wife paid for her assassination and French Legion soldiers killed Charlie Kirk, have been met with skepticism. Right-wing commentator Nick Fuentes publicly demanded proof, calling her stories 'crazy' and lacking evidence, particularly mocking her claims about Brigitte Macron's family history and gender.

title: Apple iPhone 17 available for Rs 45,900 in Croma Black Friday Sale: Know how to grab the deal
description: Croma's Black Friday Sale offers the iPhone 17 at an effective Rs 45,900, a significant reduction from its Rs 82,900 launch price. This deal, valid until November 30, 2025, combines bank cashback, substantial exchange value, and a fixed bonus.  It makes Apple's latest non-Pro model more accessible, featuring a 120Hz ProMotion display and the A19 chip.

title: Delhi man takes dummy ‘corpse’ to funeral to fake employee death, claim insurance
description: A Delhi man was apprehended in Uttar Pradesh for attempting to defraud an insurance company by presenting a mannequin as his deceased employee. He planned to cremate the dummy, obtain a death certificate, and claim a Rs 50 lakh insurance policy to clear his debts. The employee, unaware of the plot, was contacted by police.

title: India's new quake map: Himalayan arc in highest danger zone; major shift in decades
description: India has released a new earthquake map. The entire Himalayan region is now in the highest risk zone. Over 60% of India faces moderate to high earthquake hazards. New building codes will ensure greater safety. Infrastructure projects must meet stricter standards. This update reflects a scientific approach to seismic assessment.

title: 'Getting involved in criminal activities': UAE halts visas for most Pakistanis
description: UAE has significantly curtailed visa issuance for Pakistanis, narrowly avoiding a complete passport ban. This move, reportedly due to concerns over criminal activities by visitors, has caused considerable difficulty for Pakistani nationals seeking entry. Meanwhile, UAE officials highlight visa facilitation reforms, processing hundreds of visas daily at a new center.

title: Apple vs $38 billion fine: Apple goes to High Court to avoid penalty; calls it unconstitutional and unjust
description: Apple is challenging India's new antitrust penalty framework in Delhi High Court, fearing a potential $38 billion fine based on global turnover. The iPhone maker argues the amended law, allowing penalties on worldwide revenue, is unconstitutional and disproportionate. This challenge follows an investigation into Apple's App Store practices and mandatory in-app purchase system.
